channel.title: RTL-SDR on Taubin dot CC
channel.description: Recent content in RTL-SDR on Taubin dot CC

item.title: Ariss ISS SSTV December 2019
item.description:
From December 28th 2019 11:00 UTC to January 1st 2020 18:20 UTC the International Space Station did a commemorative SSTV broadcast for 3 Russian Cosmonauts that died this year. Those three are Alexi Leonov, Valery Bykovsky and Sigmund J√§hn. I was lucky enough to be able to pull an image from the broadcast.

My wife and I spend our Christmas vacation in Christchurch, New Zealand with my in-laws usually. This provides some great chances for a nice very open view of the skies. They live in a rural area, and don‚Äôt have a lot of interference around. It‚Äôs quite great for star gazing as well as using an SDR to pull images from passing satellites.

item.title: Tracking Planes
item.description:
Tracking some planes üõ©Ô∏è using an SDR and homemade antenna

Over Christmas this past season, I spent quite a bit of time with my in-laws. While down there my father in law mentioned he was having issues getting his RTL-SDR dongle to work properly on his new laptop, and asked if I could help. For those not aware, RTL-SDR stands for RTL Software Defined Radio. They have been extremely popular for a long time for not only pulling in analog TV signals, but also tracking planes.
